title: Orange Curry Dressing

ingredients.content: 7 oz walnut oil or other nut oil
1 - 2 oranges, preferably organic, zest and juice (approx. 4.5 oz juice)
½ - 1 oz hot mustard, to taste
½ tsp curry powder, to taste

preparations.content: Place a pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in oil and set aside.
Place 4.5 oz freshly squeezed orange juice, a strip of orange zest (½ in. x ¼ in.), shallots, mustard, curry powder, salt and vinegar into mixing bowl and chop <b>20 sec/speed 8<b>.

Mix <b>3 min/speed 4<b> while very slowly pouring reserved walnut oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion. Serve or transfer into an airtight jar and store in refrigerator.

hintsAndTricks: Use Orange Curry Dressing on green leaf salads or salads combining chopped raw vegetables and fruit.
This dressing keeps for up to one week in the refrigerator.
Create your own dressing using this recipe as a basic guideline. Try different types of oil and vinegar and add seasonings and flavors of choice.
